data.enText: a plan or preparation that you make so that sth can happen
I'll make arrangements for you to be met at the airport.
data.chText: 我会安排人到机场接你。

data.enText: the way things are done or organized
She's happy with her unusual living arrangements.
data.chText: 她对自己不同寻常的生活安排方式感到很得意。

data.enText: There are special arrangements for people working overseas.
data.chText: 对赴海外工作的人员有特别安排。

data.enText: an agreement that you make with sb that you can both accept
an arrangement between the school and the parents
data.chText: 学校和家长的一项约定

data.enText: We can come to an arrangement over the price.
data.chText: 我们可以就价格问题达成一项协议。

data.enText: They had an arrangement that the children would spend two weeks with each parent.
data.chText: 他们商定，孩子们与父方母方分别各住两个星期。

data.enText: You can cash cheques here by prior arrangement with the bank.
data.chText: 你事先和银行商妥，就可以在这里兑现支票。

data.enText: a group of things that are organized or placed in a particular order or position; the act of placing things in a particular order
data.chText: 整理好的东西；整理；排列；布置

data.enText: plans of the possible seating arrangements
data.chText: 几种可行的座次安排方案

data.enText: a piece of music that has been changed, for example for another instrument to play

simple_means.memory_skill: arrange v.整理 + -ment 行为或结果

ex.zh: 正式/非正式/特殊安排（或协议）

tr: the act of arranging and adapting a piece of music
the spatial property of the way in which something is placed
an organized structure for arranging or classifying
example: he changed the arrangement of the topics
the facts were familiar but it was in the organization of them that he was original
he tried to understand their system of classification

tr: the thing arranged or agreed to
example: they made arrangements to meet in Chicago

tr: a piece of music that has been adapted for performance by a particular set of voices or instruments
an orderly grouping (of things or persons) considered as a unit

example.ex: The staff is working frantically on final arrangements for the summit...
example.tran: 工作人员正紧张忙乱地为峰会做最后准备。

example.ex: She telephoned Ellen, but made no arrangements to see her.
example.tran: 她给埃伦打了电话，但没有约她见面。

gramarinfo.label: usu pl, oft N <l>for</l> n, N to-inf

value.def: Arrangements are plans and preparations which you make so that something will happen or be possible.

example.ex: The caves can be visited only by prior arrangement...
example.tran: 这些洞穴只接受预约参观。

example.ex: Her class teacher made a special arrangement to discuss her progress at school once a month.
example.tran: 她班上的老师作了特别安排，每月讨论一次她在学业上的进展情况。

value.def: An arrangement is an agreement that you make with someone to do something.

example.ex: The house was always decorated with imaginative flower arrangements.
example.tran: 这所房子总是摆放着富有创意的插花。

example.ex: ...an arrangement of dark-blue armchairs around a coffee table.
example.tran: 咖啡桌周围摆放了一些深蓝色扶手椅

value.def: An arrangement of things, for example flowers or furniture, is a group of them displayed in a particular way.

example.ex: ...an arrangement of a well-known piece by Mozart...
example.tran: 莫扎特一首名曲的改编曲

example.ex: Glen Bronka wrote his own orchestral arrangements.
example.tran: 格伦·布朗卡把自己的曲子改编成了管弦乐曲。

value.def: If someone makes an arrangement of a piece of music, they change it so that it is suitable for particular voices or instruments, or for a particular performance.

trans: 课程安排；学校的课程设置；课程设置；課程安排
总安装（布置）图；总体布置
空间排列；按位置远近排列；空间布置；空间排布；位置遥近排列
布置图；布置图,配置图；配置图
筹资安排，资金供应办法
并联装置（电路）；平行排列
